explanations.description: A local (example specific) decision-boundary explanation of evidence towards classes
An explanation by example method that finds accurate approximations of the difference in loss at a test image due caused by retraining the model with the exclusion of a train image

additional_arguments.name: damping
additional_arguments.description: Used when calculating the Hessian Vector Product for mini_batches

additional_arguments.name: mini_batch
additional_arguments.description: If true the Explainer will calculate the hessian vector product additively over small batches of the train data at a time

additional_arguments.name: label
additional_arguments.description: The class the test image belongs to

additional_arguments.name: cache
additional_arguments.description: If the test image has not been used before, and cache is True, then the results will be saved to the Explainer object, if the image has already been cached, and cache is true, then the previous result will be returned rather than re-computing influence
